intro: Spergula coreana, commonly known as Korean spurge, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Spergula coreana is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
